The New Mexicans going above and beyond are an inspiration and give me hope that there's still real good happening in the midst of a daunting time. I’ll be sharing their stories on social media w/ the hashtag #HometownHeroesNM—be sure to follow along and join me in thanking them!

Do you know someone in New Mexico who has made a significant difference in your life or community during the #COVID19 pandemic? Nominate a Hometown Hero here: https://t.co/gzVnW8mnRW #HometownHeroesNM

With the school year cut short, Andrea Tafoya, a first grade teacher in Las Vegas, drove to visit her students—from a safe distance away in her car—to tell them she's still their teacher & will do everything she can to support them. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/4lKw2wor5O

Our small business community is finding creative ways to help out fellow New Mexicans. When there were shortages in supplies, the Rolling Still distillery in Taos turned their attention to making hand sanitizer. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/gQ44XIhXFW

El censo es confidencial; su información no será compartida con otras agencias. Y el censo NO incluye una pregunta sobre la ciudadanía. Complete el censo para apoyar los programas críticos de los que dependen nuestras comunidades.

Hoy es #CensusDay, y también es el Día de los Inocentes. Pero contar a todos no es un chiste. El censo ayuda a Nuevo México a recibir su parte justa de los fondos federales. Puede completer el censo por télefono, correo postal, o en línea. Empieza aqui: https://t.co/AnSFuhPgBR

The census is confidential; your information will not be shared with other agencies. And the census DOES NOT include a citizenship question. Fill out the census to support the critical programs and infrastructure that our communities depend on.

Today is #CensusDay and it’s also April Fool’s Day. But getting everyone counted is no joke. The census helps make sure New Mexico gets its fair share of federal funds. You can fill out the census by phone, mail, or online. Get started here: https://t.co/AnSFuhPgBR

Health care personnel are working around the clock and need all the support we can give. Great work by a group of @UNM med students, who developed a way to connect these workers with volunteers who can help with things like child care and grocery shopping. https://t.co/YiWzA2hdo4

The workers who make it possible for more Americans to turn to online shopping in order to comply with physical distance guidelines deserve more than they are getting.

It's critical these workers have access to paid sick leave and a safe work environment. https://t.co/0GKqxyNUB2

The gender wage gap hurts families across NM now more than ever. Women deserve equal pay, now.

The Trump admin should reopen Affordable Care Act enrollment to allow people who need to purchase a health care plan a critical opportunity to do so.

The last thing we need in a public health crisis is for people to be afraid of seeking treatment because of the cost.
 
That’s why I'm calling on major health insurers to cover all COVID-19 related treatment without cost sharing requirements.

If you need assistance getting back home, visit https://t.co/CsQ7I59nc1 or call my office at (505) 346-6601.

If you're a New Mexican abroad right now trying to get back to the U.S., know that I will keep doing everything I can to get you home. My office will help connect you with the nearest Embassy and help you work with airlines.

It’s easy to feel helpless in a crisis when you’re stuck at home. If you’re looking for a great way to get out and help your community, reach out to your local food bank to offer your help. Whether you're able to give your time or extra food, your help makes a big impact.
It has been inspiring to see New Mexicans step up to help each other. That includes @RoadrunnerFdBnk, which is doing all it can to deliver food to those in need. https://t.co/IUvXWKcAMg

I will continue doing everything in my power to fight for the resources we need for an effective, science-based public health response and also help the small business owners, workers, and families whose lives and livelihoods have been upended get back on their feet.

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act will:
✅ Rapidly expand free COVID-19 testing for those who need it
✅ Provide funding to ensure meals are provided to those in need
✅ Ensure workers can access paid leave and unemployment insurance

This afternoon, the Senate put partisan politics aside to pass the emergency medical and immediate economic relief measures Americans are counting on as we confront this unprecedented public health crisis.
Hey @HBO, feel like releasing the full season of #Westworld to encourage folks to continue staying home?

When so many New Mexico families are already frightened about how they will be able to stay healthy and make ends meet, the last thing they should have to worry about is whether they can keep a roof over their heads.

I urge banks and credit unions in our state to show the same compassion and understanding by temporarily halting the enforcement of foreclosures and evictions and work with impacted parties to suspend any fees or late-payment penalties.

I commend all of the utilities and co-ops in New Mexico who have done the right thing during this time of great economic uncertainty by suspending non-payment disconnections and the enforcement of late fees. https://t.co/tNmLG5anm7

Our doctors, nurses, and medical staff are working around the clock to keep our communities safe and to quite literally save New Mexicans’ lives. 
 
You are doing incredible work--thank you.
As we all navigate through this worrisome time, I want to express my deepest gratitude to the health professionals who are on the front lines fighting the COVID-19 pandemic.

An act of kindness can go a long way, whether it's delivering groceries to someone who is unable to leave their home, or simply writing a card to someone unable to receive visitors. We are all in this together.

In a public health crisis like #COVID19, it’s critical to be able to identify and contain positive cases in our communities. If somebody needs to be tested, they should be able to receive one.

Why is it so important for New Mexicans to fill out the census and #GetCounted? 

An accurate census count makes sure NM get its fair share of federal funding, which helps support programs like:
✅ Early childhood education
✅ Medicaid

✅ SNAP benefits
Be sure to check your mail! Beginning today and over the next week, households will start to receive @uscensusbureau mailers with details on how to respond to the #2020census.

Right now, one of the best courses of action to maintain public trust in our nation’s leading health experts is for @CDCgov to hold consistent public briefings.
 
Same time, every day. 
 
Americans need to be informed.
 
Federal officials need to be transparent. Bottom line.

I’m pleased the Great American Outdoors Act provides funding to improve safety and address the maintenance backlog at @BureauIndianEdu. Students across Indian Country deserve high-quality education in a safe environment where they can learn and thrive.

This is especially important to growing the outdoor recreation economy as these agencies manage public lands for hunting, fishing, and other types of recreation. A closed campground or a trail can mean fewer visitors to an area and can have a big impact on the local economy.

In addition to funding #LWCF and fixing the @NatlParkService maintenance backlog, I am proud to have secured a provision in the bipartisan Great American Outdoors Act to address maintenance/access issues impacting public lands managed by @forestservice, @USFWS, and @BLMNational.
Ron Johnson is turning the Homeland Security Committee into an instrument of Russian disinformation.

I’ll always fight for better family leave policies, and I’m proud to join @PattyMurray and @rosadelauro to introduce legislation to provide paid sick days immediately to workers in light of the coronavirus crisis, and in preparation for future public health emergencies.

.@CDC recommends staying home if you're sick to help prevent the spread of #COVID19.
 
But the lack of a national paid leave program puts many workers in the impossible position of choosing between their health and a paycheck. https://t.co/kkuHKlQ7Th

We have data and successful demonstration projects that show us how we can make systems that serve children and parents work better together. Take a look at this graphic from @AspenAscend to get a better understanding of the 5 key components working together to build 2Gen. https://t.co/jyVobuQIER

Our current approach to poverty is not effective enough. A 2Gen approach:
✅Targets parents & children at the same time
✅Streamlines & coordinates support services for families
✅Makes services more effective at increasing economic security/educational success/health & wellbeing

Far too many families in New Mexico and across the nation are struggling to make ends meet and can’t escape multigenerational poverty. 

That's why I reintroduced the Two-Generation Economic Empowerment Act (2Gen) to increase opportunities for families living in poverty.

Upgrading Bandelier to national park status is the best way to ensure these cultural treasures and northern New Mexico’s history and natural beauty receive the recognition and permanent protection they have long deserved. #WWTRD https://t.co/j8QVgJefTJ

We will be announcing major progress on bipartisan legislation to fully, permanently fund the #LWCF and the Restore Our Parks Act to address the national parks maintenance backlog. Watch here: https://t.co/QeOPZQXAAp
Glad the president finally sees the light on #LWCF. This is the nation’s most successful, bipartisan conservation program and it needs to be permanently and fully funded. No excuses.
